item.description:
WHERE: The resevoir Spot Pond, in Stoneham, adjacent to the Stone Zoo.

WHEN: 3 hours starting at the posted time

THE SCENE: We paint 100 feet or so in the woods, on the rocky promontory overlooking distant shores of this scenic resevoir. "Idyllic scene.", per our own Ken.

WHERE TO MEET*: At the posted time, with 1/2 hour leeway for late-comers. We can meet right on the wharf next to Victoria's Station.

DIRECTIONS: From 93N, take the Fellsway West Winchester exit. Off the ramp bare right slightly and follow signs for route 28. Continue straight on route 28 about a mile until you come to lights. Friendly's will be on your left. Take a right at those lights. Continue straight 1/2 mile until you come to the Stone Zoo. Park on your far left of the parking lot. The path to our site leads into the woods. We can meet there, in the woods.

From 93S, take the Winchester Fellsway West exit, after the Winchester Highlands exit. Off the ramp, go right around the rotary (over the highway) and follow directions in the paragraph above beginning with "...bare right slightly and follow signs for route 28."

OTHER:
RSVPs: It's best to let us know you are coming so we can look for you or alert you to any changes.

THINGS TO BRING WHICH ARE OFTEN FORGOTTEN:
Mosquito repellant, Paper towels, Sweater, water, food

IF LOST: If you become lost getting there, call.

*LAX: We meet at the time above. You have 30 minutes additional slack, after which we may leave to the painting site without you.

INCLEMENT WEATHER: It is up to you to determine if the weather makes painting untenable. Although, I will try to leave a message on my voice mail if I myself do not intend to be there.

Michael Emerald
617/968-0627
westpointusma@yahoo.com
item.name: PLEIN AIR OUTING: Spot Pond, Stoneham
